item.title: Applications Integrating On The Database
item.description: The problem You shouldn’t do it. You’ve read it before. Don’t integrate applications on the database. The advice is relatively straightforward, but it can often be difficult to understand. My first piece of advice is that when you have a new process it should have it’s own database. While the overhead is often real, it is minimal compared to the pain caused when you want to pull the two processes apart later.
